This work was one of the first papers developed out of my PhD dissertation. It was a simulation study focused on the bias and variance of estimates of parameter estimates of a Gaussian mixture model if the correlation structure is incorrectly specified. 

**Product** 

[Heggeseth, B. C., & Jewell, N. P. (2018). How Gaussian mixture models might miss detecting factors that impact growth patterns. The Annals of Applied Statistics, 12(1), 222-245.](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/sim.5729)
